Description: Textile fragment; torn strip of undyed linen cloth of medium quality; spots of dark brown/black material may be resin; side-edges torn; ends cut. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and very frequently S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.34 ends per 10mm and weft 16 picks per 10mm.
Curator's comments: Resin points towards the late-ish date; frequency of splicing suggets an earliy-ish date. Resin and torn edges suggest that this was a mummy wrapping. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1993]
